description: Business Plan Creation and Implementation is an overview course of Entrepre- neurial Businesses for the entrepreneurial-minded Penn student. The course will cover opportunity assessment and feasibility analysis, as well as implementation, deal structure and operations with a special emphasis on the psychological and sociological ramifications of the entrepreneurial pursuit. Each topic is approached from a pgramatic perspective. The purpose of this course is to expose students to the entrepreneurial pursuit, its ramifications and its rewards. Thus, both class assignments and class discussions are based upon real life experiences. The lecture, the readings, the cases and the speakers all reflect that purpose.
name: BUS. PLAN CREAT. & IMPLE
